org.jtrim.collections

Class ElementRefIterable<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.collections.ElementRefIterable<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of the elements iterated by this Iterable
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<RefList.ElementRef<E>>

    public final class ElementRefIterable<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<RefList.ElementRef<E>>, java.io.Serializable
    A convenient Iterable for iterating through the element references of a RefList. This Iterable will use RefList.ElementRef.getNext(int) method of the element references of the underlying RefList and the returned iterator remains valid even if the underlying list is changed while it is being iterated. Note however that it doesn't imply thread-safety if the underlying RefList implementation is not thread-safe.

    Thread safety

    This class derives its thread-safety properties from the underlying RefList object.

    Synchronization transparency

    This class derives its synchronization transparency from the underlying RefList object. Note however that in general java.util.Collection Collection implementations are expected to be completely synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ElementRefIterable

        public ElementRefIterable(RefList<E> wrappedList)
        Creates a new Iterable based on the specified RefList. This Iterable will always start iterating from the first element of the specified list even if it was changed after creating this Iterable.
        Parameters:
        wrappedList - the underlying RefList to be used. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the supplied RefList is null

    • Method Detail

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<RefList.ElementRef<E>> iterator()
        Returns an iterator which will iterate through the elements of the underlying RefList. The iterator will always start iterating from the first element of the list.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<RefList.ElementRef<E>>
        Returns:
        an iterator iterating through each of the elements of the underlying RefList. This method never returns null.
